p: A new approach suggested by Grenfell et al. [2004] combines epidemiology and evolutionary biology, and is applicable to rapidly evolving RNA viruses. Using a two‚Äêtiered approach, Koelle et al. [2010] model the epidemiological dynamics as the first tier via a stochastic S iI iR i model for each antigenic variant, then the genetic sequence evolution as the second tier to model production of new antigenic variants. The modeling simulations can be related to phylogenetic diagrams of virus lineages (e.g., influenza A and B) ( Koelle et al. [2010]).
